And in this way, in fine, extremely volatile and inflammable sulphureous particles (such as the oils which are obtained by distillation from plants) are very likely produced from the rude mass of the earth, which seems to behave like a. caput mortuum. For the volatilisation of sulphur consists in its being liberated from a union with fixed salt. Auditis therefore clear that the fixation of sulphur arises from its intimate union wilh a fixed salt. For if sulphureous oils are combined with fixed salt, as is the case in soap, they lose their inflammability alto- gether. For soap, which is partly composed ol oil, will not blaze if thrown into the fire.
